TextView.android:text: JEE Mock Test 2021
Please read the instructions carefully
General Instructions

The clock will be set at the server. The countdown timer in the top center of the screen will display the remaining time available for you to complete the examination. When the timer reaches zero, the examination will end by itself. You will not be required to end or submit your examination.
Tap on “ ” arrow to view the Questions Palette which will appear from the bottom of the screen.
The Questions Palette will show the status of each question using one of the following symbols:
You have either not seen the question yet or you are on that question.
You have not attempted the question.
You have attempted the question..
You have NOT attempted the question, but have marked the question for review.
The question(s) “Attempted and Marked for Review” will be considered for evaluation.
Navigating to a question
To answer a question, do the following:
Tap on the question number in the Question Palette to go to that numbered question directly. Note that using this option does NOT save your answer to the current question.
Tap on Save and Next to save your answer for the current question and then go to the next question.
Tap on Mark and Next to mark the current question for review and move to the next without answering it.
Tap on Save and Mark to save your answer for the current question, mark it for review, and then go to the next question.
Answering a question
To select your answer,tap on one of the options
To deslect your chosen answer,tap on the chosen option again or tap on the clear response button at the bottom of the screen
To change your chosen answer,tap on another option.
To save your answer,you must tap on the save and next button
To mark an answered question for review,tap on the save and Mark button
Procedure for answering a multiple choice type question:
To change your answer to a question that has already been attempted,first select that question for answering and then follow the procedure for answering that type of question.
Procedure for answering a numeric type question:
you canonly enter a numeral as the answer
To erase a typed answer,tap on the clear Response button at the bottom of screen or simply erase it by using the backspace
To save your answer,you must tap on save and next button.
To mark an unanswered question for review , tap on the Save and Mark button
Procedure for answering a subjective type question:
You can write down the answer on a piece of paper, click an image of it and upload it using the “ “(attach image) icon.
You can attach a maximum of 5 images.
To delete an uploaded image, click on the “ “ (remove attachment) icon.
Tap on the Clear Response button at the bottom of the screen to delete all attachments uploaded for a particular question at any point of time.
To save your answer, you must tap on the Save and Next button.
To mark an answered question for review, tap on the Save and Mark button..
Navigating through sections (only for “Combined Test”):

Sections in this question paper are displayed on the top bar of the screen for any “Combined Test”. Questions in a section can be viewed by tapping on the section name. The section you are currently viewing is highlighted.
After tapping the Save and Next button on the last question for a section, you will automatically be taken to the first question of the next section.
You can shuffle between sections and questions anytime during the examination as per your convenience only during the time stipulated.

I have read and understood the instructions. I declare that I shall not resort to any unfair means/malpractice/cheating directly or indirectly for the duration of the entire test. I understand that if I’m found guilty of committing the aforementioned, I shall be liable to be debarred from this Test and/or to disciplinary action, which may include ban from future Tests / Examinations.
